title: Mel B 'dating her hairdresser Rory McPhee'
text:
Mel B is reportedly dating her hairdresser (Picture: Getty/Instagram)

Mel B is reportedly dating again and enjoying a ‘casual romance’ with hairdresser Rory McPhee.

According to reports, the Spice Girl ‘can’t stop smiling’ after falling for her new man, who she has known for around two years now after meeting him through her cousin.

It’s thought the pair finally decided to go public with their romance five weeks ago at a friend’s wedding.

A source told The Sun: ‘[Mel] hasn’t stopped smiling recently… sparks flew between them two years ago, but they have upped the ante by going public.

Mel and Rory have known each other for around two years now (Picture: Instagram)

‘At the wedding they looked so happy together, Mel isn’t looking for a serious relationship, and Rory is very easygoing, so they are keeping things very casual and chilled for now.’

Neither Mel or Rory have addressed the rumours, but the pair are often seen working together and she features a lot on his Instagram in work-related posts.

Metro.co.uk has reached out to Mel’s rep for comment.

Mel was previously married to ex Stephen Belafonte for 10 years, before they bitterly split and their divorce was finalised in December 2017.

She later detailed their turbulent relationship in her autobiography, Brutally Honest, accusing Stephen of physical and mental abuse, which he has denied.

Mel was previously married to ex Stephen Belafonte (Picture: Getty Images)

Since splitting from her ex, Mel has moved back to her hometown of Leeds to live with her mother and two eldest daughters from her previous relationships to dancer Jimmy Gulzar and Eddie Murphy respectively; 20-year-old Phoenix and 12-year-old Angel,

Mel does not live with her only daughter to Stephen, eight-year-old Madison, who currently lives with her dad amid an ongoing custody battle.

But despite her difficult divorce, Mel won’t rule out getting married again.

Speaking to Fabulous Digital, Mel said: ‘I would never say never. It’s not going to happen tomorrow.

‘I’m not actively looking for anything like that but, yeah, if it happens! I think I’m always going to be a lover of love and a believer of love.’

She said: ‘I’ve always been positive. Everyone goes through ups and downs in relationships. I’ve been married twice, engaged a few times, but I don’t think I’ll ever give up on love – it’s a beautiful thing.’
